key_insight: Yume-1.5 delivers text-guided, interactive world generation by combining a compact diffusion backbone, efficient sampling, and a history-aware state representation — enabling realistic, explorable worlds with far lower latency and parameter cost than prior methods.
problem_solved: Existing diffusion-based interactive world generators are too large, slow (many inference steps), and accumulate growing historical context, and most lack precise text-conditioned control. Yume-1.5 tackles these bottlenecks to enable real-time, text-controlled generation and interaction.
method: Compact text-conditioned diffusion backbone: a parameter-efficient model architecture that supports natural-language conditioning for direct text control of content and behaviours.
Fast sampling and model distillation: techniques to drastically reduce inference steps and runtime while preserving generation quality for interactive use.
History-aware state encoding: lightweight memory or compressed context mechanism that maintains long-term scene consistency without unbounded context growth.
impact: Makes real-time, text-driven world generation practical for applications like games, simulation, and AR by reducing compute, latency, and memory overhead, while preserving rich interactive behaviors and user control.
